snippet: The policies in Washington, however good they may be, are useless if they are not enacted where it counts.
abstract: Editorial underscores urgency for Obama administration to bring immigration policy in line with lawfulness and common sense; criticizes Homeland Security Dept for farming out lawful use of discretion to state and local agencies that do not recognize dangers of indiscriminate immigrant dragnet; contends directives urging more humane enforcement of immigration laws must reach the officers and sheriffs dealing directly with illegal immigrants.
lead_paragraph: The policies in Washington, however good they may be, are useless if they are not enacted where it counts.
